sense.gloss: on the wane (e.g. popularity of something), decline of one's fortunes

sdata.j: あの↑政治↑↓せいじ↓↑家↑↓か↓はいわゆるリクルート・スキャンダルが↑発覚↑↓はっかく↓して↑以来↑↓いらい↓↑落↑↓|お↓ち↑目↑↓め|↓になってしまった。
sdata.e: That politician has come down in the world since the so-called "Recruit scandal" was publicized.

sdata.j: ↑市長↑↓しちょう↓の↑人気↑↓にんき↓が↑落↑↓|お↓ち↑目↑↓め|↓になった↑途端↑↓とたん↓に、↑一斉↑↓いっせい↓に↑彼↑↓かれ↓に↑対↑↓たい↓する↑批判↑↓ひはん↓が↑噴↑↓ふ↓き↑出↑↓だ↓してきた。
sdata.e: As soon as they realized the mayor was on his way down, his critics started coming out of the woodwork.

sdata.j: ↑落↑↓|お↓ち↑目↑↓め|↓って↑言↑↓い↓うけど、まだイケるよね。
sdata.e: They say it's on the wane, but it's still got something, hasn't it?
